SEARCH
Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configuration

Class FPGA

java.lang.Object
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configuration.FPGA
Direct Known Subclasses:
ReadbackFPGA
public class FPGA extends Object
This class models the configuration of a Xilinx FPGA. This class contains the configuration data of a configured FPGA (organized as Frames) and a frame address register. This object is "configured" by using Bitstream objects (pre-parsed Xilinx bitstreams). This class is used for creating, manipulating, and querying bitstreams in Xilinx FPGAs.

  • Method Details

    • configureBitstream

      public void configureBitstream(Bitstream bitstream)
      Configure the FPGA object with the data in the bitstream packets. Iterate over each packet and individually configure them.

    • configureBitstream

      protected void configureBitstream(Packet packet)
      Perform 'configuration' operations on an individual packet. This method will respond to a subset of packets that affect the configuration process. Many packets will be ignored. The following packets are processed: FAR: update the internal FAR address
      Parameters:
      packet -

    • FDRICommand

      protected void FDRICommand(Packet packet)
      Execute a FDRI command by configuring the FPGA with the data in the packet. Note that the FAR must be set before executing this command.
      Parameters:
      packet -

    • configureWithData

      protected void configureWithData(List<Integer> data)

    • MFWRCommand

      public void MFWRCommand()
      Allows for multiple frame writes to different addresses. This function works similar to SetFrame, although frameBuffer is never changed or written to. As with SetFrame, if the write is successful, the FAR is incremented.

    • setFAR

      public void setFAR(int far)
      Set the address of the FAR.

      public void writeFDRIToCurrentFrame()
      Writes the value of the FDRI buffer into the frame at the current FAR.

    • getCurrentFrame

      public Frame getCurrentFrame()
      Obtain the frame pointed to by the current FAR address. If the current FAR is invalid, return null.

    • getFrame

      public Frame getFrame(int farAddress)
      Return the frame specified by the farAddress parameter. This method will have to perform a frame address to sequential address translation.

    • getFrame

      public Frame getFrame(FrameAddressRegister far)
      Returns the frame from the address set in the FrameAddressRegister.
      Parameters:
      far - The FAR containing the address of the frame to get.
      Returns:
      The frame object with the requested far, or null if the far is invalid.

      public ArrayList<Frame> getAllFrames()

    • getFrameContents

      public String getFrameContents()
      Return the contents of a set of continuous frames as a String.

    • getDifferingFrames

      public ArrayList<Integer> getDifferingFrames(FPGA fpga, boolean ignoreUnconfiguredFrames)
      Compares every frame of this FPGA with the FPGA passed in as a parameter and returns a list of those frames that differ in contents. This method will return a null if the parameter FPGA is a different device than this FPGA.
      Parameters:
      ignoreUnconfiguredFrames - If true, this method will only compare frames that are configured on both FPGAs.

      public String getFrameData()
